lesmer.intro: Holidays that entitle you to postpone
lesmer.avsnitt: You can postpone your parental benefit by:

liste.punkt: holidays up to four weeks and one day each year
up to ten days of holiday in advance from the next year

lesmer.intro: You can postpone using the following process

liste.punkt: Arrange with your employer as to when you will take holidays.
Your employer confirms your holiday in the income statement that they send to NAV.
In the parental benefit application, you specify that you are delaying the period because you are having a holiday
If you do not know when you will be taking holidays when you apply, you can send an application at Your Parental Benefit to postpone at a later date.

lesmer.avsnitt: Deadline: You have to apply before you start your holiday.

innhold.avsnitt: Holiday pay from the parental benefit
If you are an employee, you are entitled to holiday pay from the parental benefit. If the employer pays salary during the period of leave, the holiday pay is paid to the employer.
The holiday pay amounts to 10.2 per cent of what is paid out before tax in the first 12 or 15 weeks of the parental benefit period.
